intro: Brachystele subfiliformis, commonly known as the slender-stemmed moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its extremely narrow, filamentous stems and small, closely packed leaves. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as on rocky surfaces or in forest understories. Its structure is highly adapted for water retention, which is essential for its survival in humid conditions. Brachystele subfiliformis plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitat for various invertebrates.
